service.name: Amazon Direct Connect
service.documentation: AWS Direct Connect links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard 1 gigabit or 10 gigabit Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an AWS Direct Connect router. With this connection in place, you can create virtual interfaces directly to the AWS cloud and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, bypassing Internet service providers in your network path.

cabal.name: Amazon Direct Connect
cabal.description: AWS Direct Connect links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard 1 gigabit or 10 gigabit Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an AWS Direct Connect router. With this connection in place, you can create virtual interfaces directly to the AWS cloud and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, bypassing Internet service providers in your network path.

One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an AWS Direct Connect router. With this connection in place, you can create virtual interfaces directly to the AWS cloud and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, bypassing Internet service providers in your network path.

operations.name: AllocateConnectionOnInterconnect
operations.documentation:
Creates a hosted connection on an interconnect.

Allocates a VLAN number and a specified amount of bandwidth for use by a hosted connection on the given interconnect.

required.name: _acoiConnectionName
required.documentation:
Name of the provisioned connection.

Example: "500M Connection to AWS"

Default: None

required.name: _acoiOwnerAccount
required.documentation:
Numeric account Id of the customer for whom the connection will be provisioned.

Example: 123443215678

Default: None

required.name: _acoiInterconnectId
required.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which the connection will be provisioned.

Example: dxcon-456abc78

Default: None

required.name: _acoiVlan
required.documentation:
The dedicated VLAN provisioned to the connection.

Example: 101

Default: None

fields.name: _acoiBandwidth
fields.documentation:
Bandwidth of the connection.

Example: "500Mbps"

Default: None

fields.name: _acoiConnectionName
fields.documentation:
Name of the provisioned connection.

Example: "500M Connection to AWS"

Default: None

fields.name: _acoiInterconnectId
fields.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which the connection will be provisioned.

Example: dxcon-456abc78

Default: None

fields.name: _acoiOwnerAccount
fields.documentation:
Numeric account Id of the customer for whom the connection will be provisioned.

Example: 123443215678

Default: None

fields.name: _acoiVlan

operations.name: AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface
operations.documentation:
Provisions a private virtual interface to be owned by a different customer.

The owner of a connection calls this function to provision a private virtual interface which will be owned by another AWS customer.

Virtual interfaces created using this function must be confirmed by the virtual interface owner by calling ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface. Until this step has been completed, the virtual interface will be in 'Confirming' state, and will not be available for handling traffic.

payload.name: _apviConnectionId
payload.documentation:
The connection ID on which the private virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

required.name: _apviConnectionId
required.documentation:
The connection ID on which the private virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

required.name: _apviOwnerAccount
required.documentation:
The AWS account that will own the new private virtual interface.

Default: None

required.name: _apviNewPrivateVirtualInterfaceAllocation
required.documentation:
Detailed information for the private virtual interface to be provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apviConnectionId
fields.documentation:
The connection ID on which the private virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apviNewPrivateVirtualInterfaceAllocation
fields.documentation:
Detailed information for the private virtual interface to be provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apviOwnerAccount
fields.documentation:
The AWS account that will own the new private virtual interface.

Default: None

optional.name: _apvir1CustomerRouterConfig
optional.documentation: Information for generating the customer router configuration.

fields.name: _apvir1CustomerRouterConfig
fields.documentation: Information for generating the customer router configuration.

operations.name: AllocatePublicVirtualInterface
operations.documentation:
Provisions a public virtual interface to be owned by a different customer.

The owner of a connection calls this function to provision a public virtual interface which will be owned by another AWS customer.

Virtual interfaces created using this function must be confirmed by the virtual interface owner by calling ConfirmPublicVirtualInterface. Until this step has been completed, the virtual interface will be in 'Confirming' state, and will not be available for handling traffic.

payload.name: _apvi1ConnectionId
payload.documentation:
The connection ID on which the public virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

required.name: _apvi1ConnectionId
required.documentation:
The connection ID on which the public virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

required.name: _apvi1OwnerAccount
required.documentation:
The AWS account that will own the new public virtual interface.

Default: None

required.name: _apvi1NewPublicVirtualInterfaceAllocation
required.documentation:
Detailed information for the public virtual interface to be provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apvi1ConnectionId
fields.documentation:
The connection ID on which the public virtual interface is provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apvi1NewPublicVirtualInterfaceAllocation
fields.documentation:
Detailed information for the public virtual interface to be provisioned.

Default: None

fields.name: _apvi1OwnerAccount
fields.documentation:
The AWS account that will own the new public virtual interface.

Default: None

operations.name: ConfirmConnection
operations.documentation:
Confirm the creation of a hosted connection on an interconnect.

Upon creation, the hosted connection is initially in the 'Ordering' state, and will remain in this state until the owner calls ConfirmConnection to confirm creation of the hosted connection.

operations.name: ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface
operations.documentation:
Accept ownership of a private virtual interface created by another customer.

After the virtual interface owner calls this function, the virtual interface will be created and attached to the given virtual private gateway, and will be available for handling traffic.

required.name: _cpviVirtualGatewayId
required.documentation:
ID of the virtual private gateway that will be attached to the virtual interface.

A virtual private gateway can be managed via the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) console or the EC2 CreateVpnGateway action.

Default: None

fields.name: _cpviVirtualGatewayId
fields.documentation:
ID of the virtual private gateway that will be attached to the virtual interface.

A virtual private gateway can be managed via the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) console or the EC2 CreateVpnGateway action.

Default: None

operations.name: ConfirmPublicVirtualInterface
operations.documentation:
Accept ownership of a public virtual interface created by another customer.

After the virtual interface owner calls this function, the specified virtual interface will be created and made available for handling traffic.

optional.name: _ccrBandwidth
optional.documentation:
Bandwidth of the connection.

Example: 1Gbps (for regular connections), or 500Mbps (for hosted connections)

Default: None

fields.name: _ccrBandwidth
fields.documentation:
Bandwidth of the connection.

Example: 1Gbps (for regular connections), or 500Mbps (for hosted connections)

Default: None

operations.name: CreateConnection
operations.documentation:
Creates a new connection between the customer network and a specific AWS Direct Connect location.

A connection links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard 1 gigabit or 10 gigabit Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an AWS Direct Connect router. An AWS Direct Connect location provides access to Amazon Web Services in the region it is associated with. You can establish connections with AWS Direct Connect locations in multiple regions, but a connection in one region does not provide connectivity to other regions.

operations.name: CreateInterconnect
operations.documentation:
Creates a new interconnect between a AWS Direct Connect partner's network and a specific AWS Direct Connect location.

An interconnect is a connection which is capable of hosting other connections. The AWS Direct Connect partner can use an interconnect to provide sub-1Gbps AWS Direct Connect service to tier 2 customers who do not have their own connections. Like a standard connection, an interconnect links the AWS Direct Connect partner's network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard 1 Gbps or 10 Gbps Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end is connected to the partner's router, the other to an AWS Direct Connect router.

For each end customer, the AWS Direct Connect partner provisions a connection on their interconnect by calling AllocateConnectionOnInterconnect. The end customer can then connect to AWS resources by creating a virtual interface on their connection, using the VLAN assigned to them by the AWS Direct Connect partner.

payload.name: _ciInterconnectName
payload.documentation:
The name of the interconnect.

Example: "1G Interconnect to AWS"

Default: None

required.name: _ciInterconnectName
required.documentation:
The name of the interconnect.

Example: "1G Interconnect to AWS"

Default: None

required.name: _ciLocation
required.documentation:
Where the interconnect is located

Example: EqSV5

Default: None

fields.name: _ciBandwidth
fields.documentation:
The port bandwidth

Example: 1Gbps

Default: None

Available values: 1Gbps,10Gbps

fields.name: _ciInterconnectName
fields.documentation:
The name of the interconnect.

Example: "1G Interconnect to AWS"

Default: None

fields.name: _ciLocation
fields.documentation:
Where the interconnect is located

Example: EqSV5

Default: None

operations.name: CreatePrivateVirtualInterface
operations.documentation: Creates a new private virtual interface. A virtual interface is the VLAN that transports AWS Direct Connect traffic. A private virtual interface supports sending traffic to a single virtual private cloud (VPC).

required.name: _cpvi1NewPrivateVirtualInterface
required.documentation:
Detailed information for the private virtual interface to be created.

Default: None

fields.name: _cpvi1NewPrivateVirtualInterface
fields.documentation:
Detailed information for the private virtual interface to be created.

Default: None

optional.name: _cpvirCustomerRouterConfig
optional.documentation: Information for generating the customer router configuration.

fields.name: _cpvirCustomerRouterConfig
fields.documentation: Information for generating the customer router configuration.

operations.name: CreatePublicVirtualInterface
operations.documentation: Creates a new public virtual interface. A virtual interface is the VLAN that transports AWS Direct Connect traffic. A public virtual interface supports sending traffic to public services of AWS such as Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

required.name: _cpviNewPublicVirtualInterface
required.documentation:
Detailed information for the public virtual interface to be created.

Default: None

fields.name: _cpviNewPublicVirtualInterface
fields.documentation:
Detailed information for the public virtual interface to be created.

Default: None

optional.name: _dcrBandwidth
optional.documentation:
Bandwidth of the connection.

Example: 1Gbps (for regular connections), or 500Mbps (for hosted connections)

Default: None

fields.name: _dcrBandwidth
fields.documentation:
Bandwidth of the connection.

Example: 1Gbps (for regular connections), or 500Mbps (for hosted connections)

Default: None

operations.name: DeleteConnection
operations.documentation:
Deletes the connection.

Deleting a connection only stops the AWS Direct Connect port hour and data transfer charges. You need to cancel separately with the providers any services or charges for cross-connects or network circuits that connect you to the AWS Direct Connect location.

fields.name: _dcrConnections
fields.documentation: A list of connections.

operations.name: DescribeConnections
operations.documentation:
Displays all connections in this region.

If a connection ID is provided, the call returns only that particular connection.

fields.name: _dcoirConnections
fields.documentation: A list of connections.

operations.name: DescribeConnectionsOnInterconnect
operations.documentation: Return a list of connections that have been provisioned on the given interconnect.

field.name: _dcoiInterconnectId
field.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which a list of connection is provisioned.

Example: dxcon-abc123

Default: None

payload.name: _dcoiInterconnectId
payload.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which a list of connection is provisioned.

Example: dxcon-abc123

Default: None

required.name: _dcoiInterconnectId
required.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which a list of connection is provisioned.

Example: dxcon-abc123

Default: None

fields.name: _dcoiInterconnectId
fields.documentation:
ID of the interconnect on which a list of connection is provisioned.

Example: dxcon-abc123

Default: None

fields.name: _dirInterconnects
fields.documentation: A list of interconnects.

operations.name: DescribeInterconnects
operations.documentation:
Returns a list of interconnects owned by the AWS account.

If an interconnect ID is provided, it will only return this particular interconnect.

operations.name: DescribeLocations
operations.documentation: Returns the list of AWS Direct Connect locations in the current AWS region. These are the locations that may be selected when calling CreateConnection or CreateInterconnect.

fields.name: _dvgrVirtualGateways
fields.documentation: A list of virtual private gateways.

operations.name: DescribeVirtualGateways
operations.documentation:
Returns a list of virtual private gateways owned by the AWS account.

You can create one or more AWS Direct Connect private virtual interfaces linking to a virtual private gateway. A virtual private gateway can be managed via Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) console or the EC2 CreateVpnGateway action.

fields.name: _dvirVirtualInterfaces
fields.documentation: A list of virtual interfaces.

operations.name: DescribeVirtualInterfaces
operations.documentation:
Displays all virtual interfaces for an AWS account. Virtual interfaces deleted fewer than 15 minutes before DescribeVirtualInterfaces is called are also returned. If a connection ID is included then only virtual interfaces associated with this connection will be returned. If a virtual interface ID is included then only a single virtual interface will be returned.

A virtual interface (VLAN) transmits the traffic between the AWS Direct Connect location and the customer.

If a connection ID is provided, only virtual interfaces provisioned on the specified connection will be returned. If a virtual interface ID is provided, only this particular virtual interface will be returned.
